channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023070808
item.description:
Report X-2023070808

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON TRAILER UNDER OTHER PACKAGES - DURRING THE UNLOAD PROCESS. THE OUTER BOX WAS ALREADY WET/CORRODED. PACKAGE REMOVED FROM TRAILER AND PLACED IN TOTE. DescribePack: ONE INNER PACKAGE LEAKED AT THE CAP - CAP WAS SLIGHTLY LOOSE DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED FROM TRAILER AND PLACED IN TOTE

item.title: Report X-2023070790
item.description:
Report X-2023070790

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from the trailer and placed on the ground. Was informed by the manager who opened the trailer door that it smelled very strong as soon as he lifted the door. He noticed the hazmat package right then and notified QA personnel immediately. The hazmat package was slightly leaking so it was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazmat processing area for further inspection. Spill was very miniscule as the fiberboard absorbed majority of the liquid. DescribePack: The outside of the package is labeled "CONTAINS 12 - 1 LITERS" but inside the package were only 4 - 1 Liter plastic bottles with no other packaging material to prevent movement. The amount of empty space and room for bottles to move about during transit caused a lid on one of the 1-Liter bottles to open, resulting in 1/2 liter spill from the inside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manager who lifted the trailer door and unloaded the package immediately let QA personnel know and put the strong smelling package in a tote away from the area. The trailer was checked for any further spillage and QA personnel took the hazmat to the hazmat processing area right away so the smell would not negatively affect the package handlers who would soon be unloading the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023070772
item.description:
Report X-2023070772

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ADMIN WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD DOCK TO ADDRESS A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. THE ADMIN PROCEEDED TO PLACE PACKAGE IN HAZMAT BIN AND PROCEEDED TO TAKE IT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: METAL DRUM HAD BEEN DROPPED ON THE TOP EDGE CAUSING THE DRUM TO DENT AND CONSEQUENTLY LEAK ITS CONTENTS. THE HOLE IS VERY SMALL BUT LARGE ENOUGH TO LEAK CONTENTS OUT OF. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: AN ABSORBANT PAD WAS LAID ON THE SPILL AND THEN CLEANED UP IMMEDIATELY.

item.title: Report X-2023070768
item.description:
Report X-2023070768

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin discovered a leaking fully regulated hazmat within a UNPOP Y rated fiberboard box on the HMPA staging pallet. Prior events unknown. Over the course of reporting it was discovered that the shipper had failed to sign the OP-900. Thus, despite the 96 issued by the origin, it is believed this package is "Unprocessed." DescribePack: One of the four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.3 gallon of fluid via a pinhole-sized puncture to the body, not following any seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package and spillage was found inside a lined tote. PPE was donned and ventilation was used.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to closure cap on internal 5 gallon drum leaking, causing external box to soak in contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting box in an open contents bin and leaving it for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2023070763
item.description:
Report X-2023070763

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin discovered a leaking fiberboard box in a tote on loadside. The package was removed from operations. DescribePack: One of the three 3.78 qt plastic bottles lost 3oz of fluid from a defective cap closure. It is believed the threads are worn as the leakage is active and cannot be stifled even with a "tightened" cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The tote was lined. PPE donned, SDS consulted, ventilation utilized.

item.title: Report E-2023070536
item.description:
Report E-2023070536

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 4, 2023, one (1) 25-pound bag of Jack's Professional 20-10-20 General Purpose (UN1477) that was damaged due to improper securement during loading. As a result, approximately one (1) pound of product was released to the trailer floor and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all free-standing product. All undamaged cargo was inspected and repalletized for continued processing and shipping by the facility. The collected product, all UN1477-impacted materials, and the one (1) damaged bag were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The drum was properly labeled and possession of the waste was retained by RLC for disposal through their bulk waste stream

item.title: Report E-2023070401
item.description:
Report E-2023070401

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1760 Liquid Alg-Erase release from a 15-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 28' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 28' x 4' area of the concrete lot below due to a pallet nail puncture. The area was neutralized with citric acid. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum and all impacted absorbents were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023060744
item.description:
Report X-2023060744

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered leaking in the dangerous goods building at the Memphis Hub. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure rings and absorbent pads for dunnage. The bottom chimes of both cans were dented and this caused one of then to open up and release int's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

Report X-2023060680

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found leaking in the dangerous goods building at the Memphis hub. The fiberboard box container six metal cans were separated by a fiberboard divider and the two larger cans had positive closure rings. One of the large cans had a damaged top chime causing the lid to open releasing all of it contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to handle a wet package in unload. Once we arrived, we took the package back to the hazmat cage in a black tote and followed protocol for proper handling. DescribePack: The contents within the package had loose tops which caused internal leaking as well as external leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA responded immediately and contained the package by adding it to a tote and relocating the contents to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070600
item.description:
Report X-2023070600

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin discovered a leaking package in a UNPOP Y-rated fiberboard box with product label on the side and a faded but not illegible barcode; no diamond label or proper shipping name marked. The package was found on the HMPA staging pallet. When attempting to decipher the barcode via DTL, ten other potential undeclared hazmats were found in the shipment. Due to being unable to trap the packages or strip the trailer, SALT (the next destination) was notified of the incoming Undeclared hazmats. DescribePack: One of four 3.78 liter plastic bottles lost 2.6L of fluid due to a loose cap closure and minor denting. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Class 3 Spill PPE was donned, the SDS was consulted, and ventilation was utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023070593
item.description:
Report X-2023070593

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070593 SequenceEvent: Item arrived to facility damaged. QA was notified and immediately took action. QA responded with both a bucket and red bag to placed damaged item into. Item was then brought back to hazmat cage where it was processed and handled according to guidelines. DescribePack: Package had loose caps which caused interior leakage. Spillage was not much however, it was enough to cause damage to the exterior of package as well as interior contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package caps were tightened and placed in red bag to prevent further spillage. 2. X-2023070594 SequenceEvent: Upon arrival to facility, package was damaged. QA was called to unload are to assist in removing items. Once there, the package was placed inside a red bag and then added to a container. QA brought the tote with container over to the hazmat cage where the item was then dealt with accordingly. HESS, 105 & 39 as well as DPR and ISR was completed on package. DescribePack: Package contained bottles that had loose caps. The loose caps caused the liquid to spill our of the plastic bottles and into the box. In return, the exterior package was also damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Items were placed in a plastic tote and contained within a red bag. This helped prevent any further leakage. 3. X-2023070595 SequenceEvent: Package was leaking upon arrival. QA was notified and immediately responded to area where package was located. Item was then placed into a bag that was then placed into a tote and brought back to hazmat location. Item was handled accordingly. DPR, ISF, and HESS reports were done on this package. DescribePack: Package contained two plastic both of which contained 44oz. of disinfectant. Both bottles had loose caps that caused the bottles to leak into the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once package was picked up from unload area, it was placed into a tote that was then brought to QA location and processed according to standards.

item.title: Report X-2023070586

Report X-2023070586

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was damaged coming out of trailer.. QA retrieved the package with gloves placing in a hazardous bag & tote and took it to the Hazard Cage. Also, placed it under the vent. DescribePack: The liquid contents leaked out into the box causing the box to be wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quick and timely attention was sent to the door for immediate recovery and isolation of the damaged hazmat.
